reviews.name: Akash Kumar
reviews.descreption: Just got back from a wonderful trip and it was a great experience overall. The travel designer was easy to work with from the beginning. We received multiple itineraries from multiple groups, but the one from this company was the most flexible. Since ours was a private tour, the travel designer took the time to customize the schedule so we get to see the most we can while still feeling rested and relaxed

reviews.name: Priyank Sharma
reviews.descreption: This was our first trip and the experience could not have turned out better. First, the agents that they recommended were attentive and experienced in their efforts to determine what we wanted out of our trip and to make it happen to meet our expectations. The most difficult part of the planning process was having to make a choice of which agent to choose. They were both excellent in their planning and their proposals.

reviews.name: Raghu Suri
reviews.descreption: Our trip was truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience and we are so grateful to everyone that made it happen seamlessly. Our travel planner, Rahul was incredible. After reading our initial request and speaking with us on the phone, he designed a tour perfectly custom to what our interests were. He was always prompt and thorough in his responses and we felt very comfortable taking his recommendations

reviews.name: Ridhi Dogra
reviews.descreption: Mosaic Planers organised our visit to Kerala. They put together an itinerary that suited us. We wanted to be more off the beaten track but still comfortable. Our stays at coffee and tea plantations, safari lodge, a beach resort and houseboat on the North Kerala backwaters, were delightful and exceeded our expectations. The underlying organisation of the trip meant we had no worries about where we should be and how we should get there

reviews.name: Sanjay Kumar
reviews.descreption: We had a wonderful holiday in Rajasthan which will remain long in the memory. India is a breathtakingly beautiful country full of splendid temples and palaces, noise and colour, peaceful rural scenes and most of all friendly welcoming people. We stayed in some amazing hotels and had brilliant guides who made us feel like friends. Even the noise and bustle is an experience in itself and we enjoyed the contrast between the busy streets, quiet hotels and rural experiences.

reviews.name: Neha Sharma
reviews.descreption: We started with a few days in Mumbai & ended in Delhi, from where we visited the Taj Mahal. In between we visited Bhopal and Satpura and Kanha National Parks. It was a good mixture given the contrast between the busy cities & quiet beautiful national parks. We particularly liked the peacefulness & variety of wildlife in the countryside. The accommodation & guides were excellent throughout our stay
